The Rethink K-12 Education Summit has come to a close. Thank you for joining us today! The conversation continues at #RethinkSchool.
Kamal Hamdan (California State Univ) says that innovation shouldn't be limited to students, there must also be innovation in how teachers are prepared to educate students. #RethinkSchool
"Teaching is not about throwing content at children. It‚Äôs about giving each individual child the supports they need to grow and thrive." - Nicole Assisi (Thrive Charter Schools) #RethinkSchool
"True innovation happens when it redesigns the role of the teacher and sets them up for success‚Äù - Diane Tavenner (Summit Learning) #RethinkSchool
‚ÄúWe should also focus on rethinking how we are educating our educators so they can embrace the concept of educating the whole child." - Heather Clawson (Communities in Schools) #RethinkSchool

Nicole Assisi on tailoring the student experience to fit the individual: Provide the band-aid to the child that fell and scraped their knee. Just because a band-aid is available doesn't mean the whole class needs it at the same time. #RethinkSchool
"There is a real opportunity in education for schools to not fit kids into the same mold" - Thrive Charter School CEO, Nicole Assisi #RethinkSchool
Travis Works says goal of modern education should be to create self-motivated and self-directed thinkers that can tackle 21st century problems. #RethinkSchool
